io.github.zachohara.bukkit.craftban

Class MaterialsList

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.zachohara.bukkit.common.persistence.PersistentObject
      • io.github.zachohara.bukkit.common.persistence.PersistentList<java.lang.Integer>
        • io.github.zachohara.bukkit.craftban.MaterialsList

  • public class MaterialsList
extends io.github.zachohara.bukkit.common.persistence.PersistentList<java.lang.Integer>
    A MaterialsList is a PersistentList that stores an abstract set of block or item materials. This class also contains some static methods that act as easy interfaces between the list and the client code.
    Author:
    Zach Ohara

    • Constructor Summary

      MaterialsList(io.github.zachohara.bukkit.common.plugin.CommonPlugin owner, java.lang.String filename)
      Constructs a new MaterialsList with the given plugin as an owner, and the filename to store that data to.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MaterialsList

        public MaterialsList(io.github.zachohara.bukkit.common.plugin.CommonPlugin owner,
                     java.lang.String filename)
        Constructs a new MaterialsList with the given plugin as an owner, and the filename to store that data to. This constructor will create a new ArrayList object that will contain the data.
        Parameters:
        owner - the plugin that created this object.
        filename - the filename to store the object as.

    • Method Detail

      • addMaterial

        public boolean addMaterial(java.lang.String name)
        Adds the material with the given name to the list, and returns the success of the operation. If no material exists with the given name, this method will return false.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the material to add.
        Returns:
        the success of the operation.

      • containsMaterial

        public boolean containsMaterial(java.lang.String name)
        Determines if the list contains the material with the given name. If no material exists with the given name, this method will return false.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the material to test for.
        Returns:
        true if the given material is in the list; false otherwise.

      • containsMaterial

        public boolean containsMaterial(org.bukkit.Material m)
        Determines if the list contains the given material.
        Parameters:
        m - the material to test for.
        Returns:
        true if the given material is in the list; false otherwise.

      • listBannedMaterials

        public static boolean listBannedMaterials(io.github.zachohara.bukkit.common.command.CommandInstance instance,
                                          java.lang.String purpose,
                                          java.lang.String reportPurpose)
        Retrieves the list of materials, color it correctly, and then return it to the sender of the given command.
        Parameters:
        instance - the CommandInstance that should be responded to.
        purpose - the activity that the returned list of materials is not allowed for ("crafting" for materials that can't be crafted, etc.).
        reportPurpose - the activity that the returned list of materials is not allowed for, but given in a form that will be reported to the user ("craft" instead of "crafting", etc).
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful; false otherwise.

      • banMaterial

        public static boolean banMaterial(io.github.zachohara.bukkit.common.command.CommandInstance instance,
                                  java.lang.String purpose,
                                  java.lang.String reportPurpose)
        Bans the given material from the given purpose, and reports the sucess of the operation to the given CommandInstance.
        Parameters:
        instance - the CommandInstance that should be responded to.
        purpose - the activity that the returned list of materials is not allowed for ("crafting" for materials that can't be crafted, etc.).
        reportPurpose - the activity that the returned list of materials is not allowed for, but given in a form that will be reported to the user ("craft" instead of "crafting", etc).
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful; false otherwise.

      • isMaterialBanned

        public static boolean isMaterialBanned(java.lang.String purpose,
                                       java.lang.String material)
        Determines if the given material is banned from being used for the given purpose.
        Parameters:
        purpose - the activity that the material should be tested for.
        material - the name of the material that should tested.
        Returns:
        true if the given material is banned from the given purpose; false otherwise.

      • banMaterial

        public static boolean banMaterial(java.lang.String purpose,
                                  java.lang.String material)
        Bans a given material from being used for the given purpose.
        Parameters:
        purpose - the activity that the now-banned material is not allowed for ("crafting" for materials that can't be crafted, etc.).
        material - the name of the material that should be banned from the given purpose.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful; false otherwise.
